ygData.subject: RE: Can you respect the Crawl-Delay directive in the robots.txt while ignoring the rest?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Søren, I ran into this exact issue and yes, it can be done. If you configure the robots policy to honor robots and then use the calculate robots only

Hi S=F8ren,

I ran into this exact issue and yes, it can be done. If you co=
nfigure the robots policy to honor robots and then use the "calculate robot=
s only" setting on the precondition enforcer the crawl will effectively ign=
ore robots while respecting crawl delay.

I actually prefer it this way sin=
ce this leaves a trace in the crawl.log about which URLs would have been ex=
cluded if robots.txt had been honored.

- Kris

>
> The =
netarkivet.dk have a request from at webhotel, that would like us
> to resp=
ect the Crawl-Delay directive in robots.txt.
>
> But can we do that without=
 also respecting the other directives at
> the same time?
>
> Until now our=
 RobotsHonoringPolicy have been the 'ignore' policy, but
> we can't  use th=
e 'ignore' policy and still respect the crawl-delay
> directory or can we? =
 We are using Heritrix 1.14.4.
